langModel

Class NgramCounts

  • java.lang.Object
    • langModel.NgramCounts
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NgramCountsInterface

    public class NgramCounts
extends java.lang.Object
implements NgramCountsInterface
    Class NgramCounts: class implementing the interface NgramCountsInterface.
    Author:
    N. Hernandez and S. Quiniou (2017)

    • Field Detail

      • order

        protected int order
        The maximal order of the n-gram counts.

      • ngramCounts

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> ngramCounts
        The map containing the counts of each n-gram.

      • nbWordsTotal

        protected int nbWordsTotal
        The total number of words in the corpus. In practice, the total number of words will be increased when parsing a corpus or when parsing a NgramCountsInterface file (only if the ngram encountered is a unigram one).

    • Constructor Detail

      • NgramCounts

        public NgramCounts()
        Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaximalOrder

        public int getMaximalOrder()
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Getter of the maximal order of the n-grams in the training corpus. A private method should be considered to set the value in the class implementing the interface. In practice, the set method will be called when parsing the training corpus, or when parsing the NgramCountsInterface file (using the maximal n-gram length encountered).
        Specified by:
        getMaximalOrder in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Returns:
        the maximal order of n-grams considered.

      • getNgramCounterSize

        public int getNgramCounterSize()
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Getter of the data structure which maps the n-grams to the counts and return the number of mapped n-grams.
        Specified by:
        getNgramCounterSize in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Returns:
        the number of distinct n-grams.

      • getTotalWordNumber

        public int getTotalWordNumber()
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Getter of the total number of words attribute.
        Specified by:
        getTotalWordNumber in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Returns:
        the total number of words in the corpus (different or not)

      • getNgrams

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getNgrams()
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Getter of the data structure which maps the n-grams to the counts and return the set of n-grams present in the structure.
        Specified by:
        getNgrams in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Returns:
        the set of distinct n-grams.

      • getCounts

        public int getCounts(java.lang.String ngram)
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Getter of the data structure which maps the n-grams to the counts and return the count of a particular n-gram. If the n-gram is not present, it should return zero.
        Specified by:
        getCounts in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Parameters:
        ngram - the n-gram to consider.
        Returns:
        the count of the given n-gram.

      • incCounts

        public void incCounts(java.lang.String ngram)
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Method incrementing the count of the given n-gram. If the n-gram has never been seen before, then it sets the counts to 1, else increments the counts. The method is used when parsing a corpus file.
        Specified by:
        incCounts in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Parameters:
        ngram - the n-gram whose counts is to increase.

      • setCounts

        public void setCounts(java.lang.String ngram,
                      int counts)
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Setter of the counts of the given n-gram to a given count value. The method is used when parsing a file containing previously saved n-gram counts.
        Specified by:
        setCounts in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Parameters:
        ngram - the n-gram to consider.
        counts - the counts of the given n-gram.

      • scanTextFile

        public void scanTextFile(java.lang.String filePath,
                         VocabularyInterface vocab,
                         int maximalOrder)
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Method loading the text contained in a specified file (corresponding to a training corpus) and scanning the text to count all the n-grams of each sentence.
        Specified by:
        scanTextFile in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file corresponding to the training corpus.
        vocab - the object corresponding to the vocabulary.
        maximalOrder - the maximal order of n-grams to consider.

      • writeNgramCountFile

        public void writeNgramCountFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Method saving the current n-gram counts in a file. The file should contain one n-gram per line, each line being made of the n-gram and its count separated by a tabulation character '\t'.
        Specified by:
        writeNgramCountFile in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file used to save the counts of the n-grams.

      • readNgramCountsFile

        public void readNgramCountsFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Description copied from interface: NgramCountsInterface
        Method reading the current n-gram counts from a file. The file should contain one n-gram per line, each line being made of the n-gram and its count separated by a tabulation character '\t'. The method should also set the maximum encountered n-gram length (i.e. the NgramCountsInterface order).
        Specified by:
        readNgramCountsFile in interface NgramCountsInterface
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file in which the counts of the n-grams are saved.
